name: Le Richelieu in the French Quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was specious and clean but not super modern. The location was in the quiet portion of the French Quarter, away from the parties but close enough to walk everywhere, every front desk person was helpful and knowledgable regarding places to eat and other attractions. Enjoyed our visit. Would recommend the hotel. Best part...free parking. I basically parked the car when we got there and left it there for 2 days while we walked the French Quarter and toured the entire city.
reviews.title: Nice Place to Stay in French Quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the pros. Great location near Frenchman St and Jackson Square. Friendly staff. Free parking. Liked the balcony and the fridge. Pool seemed nice (never used it). Love the ceiling fan. However, the rooms were very dated and smelled musty. (When I got home, all of my clothes smelled musty) The decor desperately needs updating. What is the purpose of having a nonworking stove in the room? The plastic plants have to go. How about some new bedspreads and updating the bathroom and air conditioner? The TV was from 1984 (we checked).
reviews.title: Great location, not so great hotel

reviews.text: Granted, no one goes to New Orleans to spend all day in the room, but this was our 6th trip to NOLA and my least favorite hotel.
reviews.title: Good location, yet facility are out of date.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked tho hotel through expedia. Good location, only 5 minutes away from famous Boourbon street, and 5 minutes drive to Convention Center, basically, close to everywhere. This hotel has its history and that;s what I like it, but the facility needs to be updated, may be not many business people live here, well I am on business trip, there still need to have a business center for people to check emails, etc., even they provide wire less. It would be much better if they have a business center for people to check emails, but they don't have it. A/C is very old and need to updated, noise at night.
reviews.title: Our Second stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a hotel with history, good location.
reviews.title: Lovely. Great Staff.

reviews.text: We traveled to New Orleans for a wedding in March and chose Le Richelieu based on Trip Advisor comments. We were not disappointed! Hotels in the Quarter tend to be very pricey, so this was a special find. We liked that it was a few blocks away from the heart of the busiest area, so the streets were quieter (especially in the evening). Yet it was an easy walk to the French Market, the riverfront, Canal Street and the Faubourg-Marigny district, full of inviting nightclubs and cafes. And there is a great coffee house, EnVie, half a block away.
reviews.title: French Quarter ambience in a quiet locale at a good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room overlooked the interior courtyard and pool. It was fine for our needs, though we would have liked two queen beds, rather than two doubles. The bathroom could use an overhaul -- it was pretty dated -- but functional and very clean. The free wi-fi in our room was very temperamental: at best, it was slow; at worst, it just didn't work for moments on end. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, however, ready with maps and directions restaurant suggestions.
reviews.title: Great experience everytime

reviews.text: A great added bonus is that this the ONLY hotel in the French Quarter that has free parking. This was another draw for us in choosing to stay here, since we drove to New Orleans on a road trip. I would have been reluctant to pay $20-25 a night for valet parking at another hotel.
reviews.title: Great location and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel several times. We love the quietness, away from the mob on Bourbon St. Walking distance to all the antique and art shops on Chartres and Royal streets. St. Louis Sq etc. The owner lives on the premises so it is well kept and the staff is very friendly. Free parking a nice bonus. The last time, we stayed in the Paul McCartney suite and the matress is a lot better than in some of the regular suites and standard rooms where we previously stayed. Worth the extra $'s.
reviews.title: comfortable room quiet location near everything.
Le Richelieu/French Quarter
reviews.text: Wonderful stay. The hotel is nice and well run. Sure the rooms are older and outdated, but they are clean. Love the quiet location, but walking distance to everything.

Wonderful, charming, and quaint hotel. Paid the extra little bit to have a one bedroom suite with a balcony....totally worth it!!!!! You will not hear Bourbon St...yet you are able to walk there, Cafe Du Monde, really anywhere in the French Quarter. We absolutely loved the friendliness of the hotel staff. The hotel is old, but feels very Victorian....and absolutely perfect.
reviews.title: PERFECT hotel for a French Quarter get-away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights in a suite. We have been to this hotel several times over the last 18 years. The good news is it is located in a quiet neighborhood with free parking. The bad news is that nothing has improved or really changed since our first visit.
reviews.title: Outdated and Needs Upgrading

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The furniture is the exact same except showing even more scratches and dents over the years. The tv was so old school we couldn't believe it worked. (We're talking floor model in a wooden framed Magnavox!) The elevators which had a very stuffy smell sometimes hesitated between floors.
reviews.title: After Room Snafu, It Got Better

reviews.text: Although we were staying in a suite w/ a kitchen there were NO utensils - not even a coffeepot or a microwave. (We went out to Walmart and actually bought our own microwave to use for the week.) The stove was blocked off so it couldn't be used. The original tiling decorated botht he kitchen and bath. (Don't get me started about the bath! The old shower had no pressure AND the knob actually fell off in my hand while I was turning it on.)
reviews.title: Not much on amenities but big on service

reviews.text: When we were making our reservations, I called the hotel directly and they did match the best price I found on the web. Otherwise I could have paid 25 bucks more pernight for this really weird experience. My husband and I called the place "The Shining 2".
reviews.title: Dated

reviews.text: We stayed at Le Richelieu for 4 nights in February, 2010 and I have to say that it's been a long time since I've stayed in a hotel that is as run down and grimy as this one. Generally, I prefer staying in locally owned hotels, but this one was very disappointing. It desparately needs some paint touch up or at least a good wash of woodwork; new carpeting in public areas and carpets cleaned in rooms, deep cleaning of bathroom tiles and blankets and bedspreads that aren't decades-old pilled polyester. I have to assume that the owner has been caught in a double-whammy of a the Katrina tragedy and the awful economy, but that doesn't excuse the layers of grime, peeling wallpaper and leftover hair in the bathroom, and the room prices were too high for the lack of quality.
reviews.title: Grimy, shabby and poor value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are nice and helpful. That is a plus, but I have to say that everywhere we went in the city, people were friendly.
reviews.title: Good place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here because we drove and wanted the free parking. The room surpassed my cleanliness standard. The ceiling fan was dust free! Which, without the ceiling fan on, it did get stuffy in the room on the 4th floor (and that was with very cold temperatures the first week in Feb.). I liked the old school blue tiled bathroom. Turning in and collecting the key wasn't as big of a hassle as I thought it would be. It was actually nice to not have to worry about. Location was fine.
reviews.title: Clean, Friendly, Quiet and close to the New Orleans Scene

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great place to find.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked for a Quiet suite and got it. 4th floor corner at the end of the hall.
reviews.title: New Orleans Charm

aka: Le Richelieu In The French Quarter Hotel New Orleans
description: Le Richelieu is a small hotel, 85 rooms, located in the historic French Quarter. We have a cafe & bar which overlook our courtyard & swimming pool area. Our in-room amenities include private baths, satellite television, refrigerator, telephone with Free Wireless Internet, Free local calls, hairdryer, iron & full-size ironing board. We also feature Secure, Self Parking On Premises.
